sen.j: 洞川温泉（どろがわおんせん）は、奈良県吉野郡天川村洞川（旧国大和国）にある温泉。
sen.e: Dorogawa hot spring (Dorogawa onsen) is a hot spring in Dorogawa, Amakawa Mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture (the former Yamato Province).
Dorogawa onsen is a hot spring in Dorogawa, Tenkawa-mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture (the former Yamato Province).

sen.j: 洞川の地は、日本百名山の一つである大峰山・山上ヶ岳の登山口にあたる。
sen.e: Dorogawa is a starting point for a climb of Mt. Sanjogatake of Mt. Omine, which is one of one hundred top mountains of Japan.
Dorogawa is a starting point for a climb of Mt. Sanjogatake of Omine mountain range, which is one of 100 top mountains of Japan.

sen.j: この山は女人禁制の修験の山である。
sen.e: This mountain is a mountain for practice, and women are prohibited from entering.

sen.j: 夏期には山上ヶ岳の蔵王堂をめざして修行に訪れる修験者や参詣者で非常ににぎわう。
sen.e: In summer time, the mountain is very crowded with practitioners of Shugen-do (Shugendo [Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts]) who head for Zao-do Hall of Mt. Sanjogatake or worshippers.

sen.j: 反面、冬季は厳しい寒さに閉ざされる。
sen.e: On the contrary, in winter time, the mountain is closed up for the severity of the winter.

sen.j: バス：近畿日本鉄道近鉄吉野線下市口駅から奈良交通バスで約1時間「洞川温泉」下車。
sen.e: By bus: one hour away by Nara Kotsu Bus, from Shimoichiguchi station, Kintetsu Yoshino line of Kinki Nippon Railway Company, get off at `Dorogawa hot springs.'

sen.j: 車 ：国道309号 新川合トンネル越えてすぐ、（）川合交差点から奈良県道21号大峯山公園線を洞川方面へ。
sen.e: By car: take National Route 309, and take the Ominesan Park Road of Nara Prefectural Route 21 at Kawai Crossing for Dorogawa just after passing through Shinkawai Tunnel (refer to the map of Tenkawa-mura Village).

sen.j: 又は下市町から奈良県道48号洞川下市線を南下して洞川方面へ。

sen.j: いわゆる温泉街は無く、町の中を大峯山への参道が通り、両側に2階建の旅館が立ち並んでいる。
sen.e: There isn't so-called hot spring town across the town, but there is a sando (an approach to the temple) leading to Mt. Omine, and two storied Japanese Inns are lined along the both sides of sando.

sen.e: The hot spring itself has a short history, but it has a long history as a town of Japanese Inns of 大峰講.

sen.e: It is said that the hot spring was developed by descendants of oni demon that followed EN no Ozunu (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the 7 century).
